alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 05 at 8:17PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN ALBANY COUNTY... At 915 PM MDT...A snow squall was along a line extending from near North Crow Campground to Laramie...and moving southeast at 45 mph. At 906 PM MDT, Laramie Airport reported one-half mile visibility with moderate snow. HAZARD...Sudden and brief periods of moderate to heavy snowfall, gusty winds, and significantly reduced visibilities. SOURCE...Radar and Observations. IMPACT...Hazardous travel conditions due to slick roads and low visibilities. Locations impacted include... Laramie, Tie City Campground, Vedauwoo, University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium, The Buttes, Vedauwoo Campground, Buford, Yellow Pine Campground and Pumpkin Vine. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Expect rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Motorists are urged to use extreme caution if traveling through these areas!
